title: Moment police Taser knife wielding robber wearing clown mask in McDonald’s
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

This is the heart-stopping moment a robber wearing a creepy clown mask is Tasered by police while raiding a McDonald’s a knifepoint.

Zachery Ryan, 41, was caught by two officers who had popped in for a coffee break at the busy Coventry restaurant at exactly the right time.

CCTV footage shows the assailant burst into the building and running behind the counter at around midnight on August 7.

He threatens the manager by pressing an eight inch blade into his stomach and ordering him to open the tills.

Advertisement

After noticing the commotion, one officer Tasers the assailant while his partner bundles him into the kitchen.

CCTV shows the terrifying moment Zachery Ryan storms into the McDonald’s (Picture: SWNS)

The creepy mask used by the 41-year-old robber (Picture: SWNS)

Ryan, of no fixed address, admitted robbery and was jailed for five weeks at Warwick Crown Court yesterday.

Judge Andrew Lockhart QC said: ‘The robbery had clearly been planned because he had gone there with the mask and knife.

‘He poses a significant risk of causing serious harm by the commission of further offences.’

The court heard Ryan had a previous conviction for armed robbery when he was jailed for 15 years.

West Midlands Police also released bodycam footage worn by one of the hero officers showing Ryan handcuffed on the floor of the kitchen.

The relieved manager, 28, approaches and says: ‘Where did you guys come from? Thank you very much.’

He ran around the counter and pressed a knife to the manager’s stomach (Picture: SWNS)

Ryan demanded money and got agitated when he was told there wasn’t much to give (Picture: SWNS

The officer replies: ‘It’s alright mate, we were just coming in for a drink, we were just there.’

Recalling the robbery, the manager said: ‘I was in the office having finished my shift when I heard a scream from one of my team.

‘I ran out to find a man in a clown mask holding a big knife. I can remember the light glinting off the blade. All I could see was his eyes.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He made threats for money and when I told him we only had one till with cash, and that there wasn’t much in it, he got agitated and pushed the knife against my stomach.

‘I turned to go back to the office, to buy some time. I knew it was a case of fight or flight and I had a decision to make.

‘But the moment I turned my back I heard a loud crack. I didn’t realise at the time but it was the sound of the police officer’s taser going off.

He was jailed for five weeks at Warwick Crown Court yesterday (Picture: SWNS)

The police officers were there at exactly the right time (Picture: SWNS)

‘One moment I was being threatened at knifepoint and the next the guy was on the floor and in handcuffs.

‘I thought “wow” where did you guys come from. It was like a miracle and perfect timing.

‘I’ll always be grateful for what they did that night. They and their colleagues are welcome to pop in for a coffee on their break whenever they like.’

Detective Inspector Kat Sibley said: ‘The officers were patrolling shortly after midnight and had stopped on a ‘refs’ break. They were in exactly the right place at the right time.

‘Thankfully no-one was hurt and the man has rightly been handed a jail term for what was a nasty robbery.’

description: CCTV shows police officers Tasering a robber wearing a clown mask in a McDonald's in Coventry.
